Race.SpecificTitle: PW Law Enf. Dist. -- 6.47 Mills - Sheriff - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Law Enforcement District Proposition
(Tax Continuation)

Summary:  10 year, 6.47 mills tax continuation for the purpose of providing additional funding for the Allen Parish Law Enforcement District.
Race.FullText: Shall the Law Enforcement District of the Parish of Allen, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy a special tax of six and forty-seven hundredths (6.47) mills on all the property subject to taxation in said District (an estimated $491,720 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2012 and ending with the year 2021, for the purpose of providing additional funding for the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW School Board -- 1% S&U Tax - SB - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(School Board Sales Tax Renewal)

Summary:  Authority for the Parish School Board to continue to levy and collect a 1% sales and use tax for a period of 10 years to supplement other revenues for the payment of salaries of teachers and other employees and operating expenses.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish School Board of the Parish of Allen, State of Louisiana (the "School Board"), under the provisions of Article VI, Section 29(A) of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, and other constitutional and statutory authority, be authorized to continue to levy and collect a tax of one percent (1%) (the "Tax") (an estimated $2,200,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years from March 1, 2013, upon the sale at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the consumption, and the storage for use or consumption, of tangible personal property and on sales of services in the Parish of Allen (the "Parish"), all as defined by law, with the proceeds of the Tax (after paying the reasonable and necessary costs and expenses of collecting and administering the Tax), to be used exclusively, to supplement other revenues available to the School Board for the payment of salaries of teachers in the public elementary and secondary schools of the Parish, and for the expenses of operating said schools, such operating expenses to include but not be limited to payment of salaries of other personnel employed by the School Board in addition to teachers?

Race.SpecificTitle: School Dist. No. 1 -- 41.87 Mills - SB - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
School District No. 1 Proposition
(Tax Continuation)

Summary:  10 year, 41.87 mills tax continuation for improving, furnishing, operating and maintaining public school houses and buildings in School District No. 1.
Race.FullText: Shall School District No. 1 of the Parish of Allen, State of Louisiana (the "District"), continue to levy a special tax of forty one and eighty-seven hundredths (41.87) mills on all the property subject to taxation within said District (an estimated $90,235 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten years, beginning with the year 2013 and ending with the year 2022, for the purpose of improving, furnishing, operating and maintaining public school houses and buildings in the District, said millage to represent an eleven and twelve hundredths mills (11.12) increase over the 30.75 mills tax authorized to be levied through the year 2012 pursuant to an election held on May 3, 2003?

Race.SpecificTitle: School Dist. No. 4 -- 12.66 Mills - SB - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
School District No. 4 Proposition
(Tax Continuation)

Summary:  10 year, 12.66 mills tax continuation for improving, furnishing, operating and maintaining public school houses and buildings in School District No. 4.
Race.FullText: Shall School District No. 4 of the Parish of Allen, State of Louisiana (the "District"), continue to levy a special tax of twelve and sixty-six hundredths (12.66) mills on all the property subject to taxation within said District (an estimated $51,058 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2013 and ending with the year 2022, for the purpose of improving, furnishing, operating and maintaining public school houses and buildings in the District, said millage to represent a two and eight hundredths mills (2.08) increase over the 10.58 mills tax authorized to be levied through the year 2012 pursuant to an election held on November 5, 2002?

Race.SpecificTitle: School Dist. No. 5 -- $8,300,000 Bond - SB - 20 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
School District No. 5 Proposition
(Bond)

Summary:  To authorize not exceeding $8,300,000 of not exceeding 20 year General Obligation School Bonds of School District No. 5 of the Parish of Allen, for the purpose of acquiring and/or improving lands for building sites and playgrounds, including construction of necessary sidewalks and streets adjacent thereto; purchasing, erecting and/or improving school buildings and other school related facilities within and for the District and acquiring the necessary equipment and furnishings therefor, title to which shall be in the public, said bonds to be payable from ad valorem taxes.
Race.FullText: Shall School District No. 5 of the Parish of Allen, State of Louisiana (the "District"), incur debt and issue bonds to the amount of not exceeding Eight Million Three Hundred Thousand Dollars ($8,300,000), to run not exceeding twenty (20) years from date thereof, with interest at a rate not exceeding eight per centum (8%) per annum, for the purpose of acquiring and/or improving lands for building sites and playgrounds, including construction of necessary sidewalks and streets adjacent thereto; purchasing, erecting and/or improving school buildings and other school related facilities within and for the District and acquiring the necessary equipment and furnishings therefor, title to which shall be in the public; which bonds will be general obligations of the District and will be payable from ad valorem taxes to be levied and collected in the manner provided by Article VI, Section 33 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974 and statutory authority supplemental thereto, with an estimated increase of one and sixty hundredths mills (1.60) to be levied in the first year of issue above the 21.80 mills currently being levied to pay General Obligation Bonds of the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: School Dist. Wd. One -- $2,995,000 Bond - SB - 20 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
School District Ward One Proposition
(Bond)

Summary:  To authorize not exceeding $2,995,000 of not exceeding 20 year General Obligation School Bonds of School District Ward One of the Parish of Allen, for the purpose of acquiring and/or improving lands for building sites and playgrounds, including construction of necessary sidewalks and streets adjacent thereto; purchasing, erecting and/or improving school buildings and other school related facilities within and for the District and acquiring the necessary equipment and furnishings therefor, title to which shall be in the public, said bonds to be payable from ad valorem taxes.
Race.FullText: Shall School District Ward One of Allen Parish, Louisiana (the "District"), incur debt and issue bonds to the amount of not exceeding Two Million Nine Hundred Ninety-Five Thousand Dollars ($2,995,000), to run not exceeding twenty (20) years from date thereof, with interest at a rate not exceeding eight per centum (8%) per annum, for the purpose of acquiring and/or improving lands for building sites and playgrounds, including construction of necessary sidewalks and streets adjacent thereto; purchasing, erecting and/or improving school buildings and other school related facilities within and for the District and acquiring the necessary equipment and furnishings therefor, title to which shall be in the public; which bonds will be general obligations of the District and will be payable from ad valorem taxes to be levied and collected in the manner provided by Article VI, Section 33 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974 and statutory authority supplemental thereto, with an estimated twenty three and sixty-five hundredths mills (23.65) to be levied in the first year of issue to pay said Bonds?

Race.SpecificTitle: Hospital Service Dist. No. 3 -- 12 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Hospital Service District No. 3 Proposition
(Tax Renewal)

Summary:  10 year, 12 mills property tax renewal to be dedicated and used for the purpose of paying costs associated with operating, maintaining, renovating and improving those facilities of the Allen Parish hospital related to providing emergency medical services, and acquiring equipment and furnishings therefor.
Race.FullText: Shall Hospital Service District No. 3 of the Parish of Allen, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy a twelve (12) mills tax on all the property subject to taxation within the District, for a period of ten (10) years, (an estimated $675,600.00 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), beginning with the year 2013 and ending with the year 2022, to be dedicated and used for the purpose of paying costs associated with operating, maintaining, renovating and improving emergency medical services, and acquiring equipment and furnishings therefor?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Protection Dist. No. 4 -- 6.97 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Fire Protection District No. 4 Proposition
(Tax Renewal)

Summary:  Authority to renew the levy of a 10 year, 6.97 mills tax for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and/or operating fire protection facilities and equipment in and for Fire Protection District 
No. 4.
Race.FullText: Shall Fire Protection District No. 4 of the Parish of Allen, State of Louisiana (the "District"), be authorized to continue to levy a special tax of six and ninety-seven hundredths (6.97) mills on all the property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $160,310 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2013 and ending with the year 2022, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and/or operating fire protection facilities and equipment in and for the District, and paying the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes?
